page.title: 14RELIGION IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: About 100 people regularly attend church services at{St Peter and St {Paul's Parish Church,Hambledon}and this rises to about 260 for Christmas or Easter services. There are 20 men, women and children in the choir, aged 9-72 years. There are 10 bell ringers and bells are rung twice on Sunday. The church has links with the {Methodist's}Chapel in the village and they go to each others' services. {Roman Catholics}have mass in the church once a month. Mrs. Barratt, a church warden, believes that the church will be used more frequently in years to come, for concerts and exhibitions for example, rather than being mostly unused for 6 days a week.
